raw: * Contains information about images (size, format, clipping, ...) and
* other resources like CSS files, local data, ...

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Contains information about images (size, format, clipping, …) and other resources like CSS files, local data, …

raw: * @type {Map} the shared image registry
* @type {Map} prefix per library used in HTTPS mode for IE

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Map} prefix per library used in HTTPS mode for IE

raw: * Detects whether there is a high-resolution image available.
* A high-resolution image is assumed to have the same file name as
* the parameter source, but with a pixelRatio identifier before the file
* extension, like "@2x".
* Medium Resolution: "example.png", high-resolution: "example@2x.png"
* @param lowResImgSrc {String} source of the low resolution image.
* @param factor {Number} Factor to find the right image. If not set calculated by getDevicePixelRatio()
* @return {String|Boolean} If a high-resolution image source.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Detects whether there is a high-resolution image available. A high-resolution image is assumed to have the same file name as the parameter source, but with a pixelRatio identifier before the file extension, like "@2x". Medium Resolution: "example.png", high-resolution: "example@2x.png"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: lowResImgSrc {String} source of the low resolution image.
@param.description: source of the low resolution image.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: factor {Number} Factor to find the right image. If not set calculated by getDevicePixelRatio()
@param.description: Factor to find the right image. If not set calculated by getDevicePixelRatio()

raw: * Returns the source name for the high-resolution image based on the passed
* parameters.
* @param source {String} the source of the medium resolution image.
* @param pixelRatio {Number} the pixel ratio of the high-resolution image.
* @return {String} the high-resolution source name or null if no source could be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the source name for the high-resolution image based on the passed parameters.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: source {String} the source of the medium resolution image.
@param.description: the source of the medium resolution image.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pixelRatio {Number} the pixel ratio of the high-resolution image.
@param.description: the pixel ratio of the high-resolution image.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} the high-resolution source name or null if no source could be found.
@return.description: the high-resolution source name or null if no source could be found.

raw: * Get all known resource IDs.

* @return {Array|null} an array containing the IDs or null if the registry is not initialized

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pathfragment{String|null|undefined} an optional path fragment to check against with id.indexOf(pathfragment)

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array|null} an array containing the IDs or null if the registry is not initialized
@return.description: an array containing the IDs or null if the registry is not initialized

raw: * Whether the registry has information about the given resource.

@param.body: id {String} The resource to get the information for
@param.description: The resource to get the information for

raw: * Returns the width of the given resource ID,
* when it is not a known image 0 is
* returned.
* @param id {String} Resource identifier
* @return {Integer} The image width, maybe null when the width is unknown

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the width of the given resource ID, when it is not a known image 0 is returned.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The image width, maybe null when the width is unknown
@return.description: The image width, maybe null when the width is unknown

raw: * Returns the height of the given resource ID,
* when it is not a known image 0 is
* returned.
* @param id {String} Resource identifier
* @return {Integer} The image height, maybe null when the height is unknown

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the height of the given resource ID, when it is not a known image 0 is returned.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The image height, maybe null when the height is unknown
@return.description: The image height, maybe null when the height is unknown

raw: * Returns the format of the given resource ID,
* when it is not a known image null
* is returned.
* @param id {String} Resource identifier
* @return {String} File format of the image

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the format of the given resource ID, when it is not a known image null is returned.

raw: * Returns the format of the combined image (png, gif, ...), if the given
* resource identifier is an image contained in one, or the empty string
* otherwise.
* @param id {String} Resource identifier
* @return {String} The type of the combined image containing id

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the format of the combined image (png, gif, …), if the given resource identifier is an image contained in one, or the empty string otherwise.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} The type of the combined image containing id
@return.description: The type of the combined image containing id

raw: * Converts the given resource ID to a full qualified URI
* @param id {String} Resource ID
* @return {String} Resulting URI

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Converts the given resource ID to a full qualified URI

raw: * Construct a data: URI for an image resource.
* Constructs a data: URI for a given resource id, if this resource is
* contained in a base64 combined image. If this is not the case (e.g.
* because the combined image has not been loaded yet), returns the direct
* URI to the image file itself.
* @param resid {String} resource id of the image
* @return {String} "data:" or "http:" URI

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Construct a data: URI for an image resource. Constructs a data: URI for a given resource id, if this resource is contained in a base64 combined image. If this is not the case (e.g. because the combined image has not been loaded yet), returns the direct URI to the image file itself.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: resid {String} resource id of the image

raw: * Checks whether a given resource id for an image is a font handle.
* @param resid {String} resource id of the image
* @return {Boolean} True if it's a font URI

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks whether a given resource id for an image is a font handle.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: resid {String} resource id of the image

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} True if it's a font URI
@return.description: True if it's a font URI

raw: * Returns the correct char code, ignoring scale postfix.
* The resource ID can be a ligature name (eg `@FontAwesome/heart` or `@MaterialIcons/home/16`),
* or a hex character code (eg `@FontAwesome/f004` or `@FontAwesome/f004/16`)
* @param source {String} resource id of the image
* @returns charCode of the glyph

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the correct char code, ignoring scale postfix. The resource ID can be a ligature name (eg @FontAwesome/heart or @MaterialIcons/home/16), or a hex character code (eg @FontAwesome/f004 or @FontAwesome/f004/16)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: source {String} resource id of the image
